TopicTitle: Textures are messed up when used in KSP.

Articles.Content:
I have my model in unity and the textures are set right, displayed right and tried "KSP Diffuse"(got that from the part tools) and regular diffuse. I have exported my model and textures from unity like is mentioned in this tutorial but this is what happens:

Unity:

KSP:

What is the problem here and what can I do to fix it?

Thanks!

Edited November 9, 2014 by dominique120
1 KSP shader per object. you probably have MultiSub object materials carrying over from Max.

1 KSP shader per object. you probably have MultiSub object materials carrying over from Max.

That is exactly what I have in MAX. One Multi/sub object material with 17 submaterials(some of these submaterials have submaterials of their own). I'll have to split it all up for it to work I guess. Thanks!

1 KSP shader per object. you probably have MultiSub object materials carrying over from Max.

I wish this was a sticky, this is easily the most asked question. My thread here covers this problem.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/75803-Only-a-fraction-of-my-custom-part-loads-into-KSP

I'll rewrite it to be simpler & more clearly define the solution.

edit: no offense dominique, sweet model. It would be easier to break this craft up though. Into main fuselage, wing sections, and engines. It will make the .cfg so much easier
